questions.question_text: Which Dockerfile produces an efficient image rebuild when the exposed port Python dependency, or MyApp source code is modified?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. If the requirements file does not change the layer is not modified and neither is the dependency install one.

Selected Answer: B
Doesn't have to copy the requirements file alone. It is in the app directory.

questions.question_text:
A new banking application is being developed as the main currency exchange resource for all the customers on a global scale. The application must comply with the security based on the deployed region. Therefore, the CI/CD pipeline must be created with the highest security possible.

Which approach accomplishes this goal?

choices.A: Give the accounts used in the CI/CD pipeline full administrative rights to all applications
choices.D: Never use one-time passwords in CI/CD pipeline
choices.C: Ensure that secrets are not inadvertently passed on during builds for pull requests via CI/CD pipeline
choices.B: Use the same passwords across the entire CI/CD pipeline

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Agree with C.

questions.question_text:
An IT team plans to deploy a new service built on top of an existing service. The capacity needed for the new service is difficult to estimate because the demand for the new service is undetermined. The team has these deployment requirements:
• A subset of the users of the original service must be migrated to the new service based on their profile
• The new service must be rolled back easily if capacity exceeds estimates

Which deployment strategy must be used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Agree with D.

questions.question_text: A DevOps engineering wants to build an application implementation based on the CI/CD pipeline model. Which service should be used to provide hosted continuous service for open and private projects?
A DevOps engineer has built a new container and must open port 8080 for intercontainer communication. Which command must be added in a Dockerfile to accomplish this goal?
